text: Gasterosteus is a genus of ray-finned fishes belonging to the family Gasterosteidae in the suborder Gasterosteoidei. These fishes are found in freshwater, brackish water and marine habitats in the Holarctic region. == Species == * Gasterosteus aculeatus Linnaeus, 1758 (Three-spined stickleback) * †Gasterosteus crenobiontus Băcescu & R. Mayer, 1956 (Techirghiol stickleback) * Gasterosteus islandicus Sauvage, 1874 (Iceland stickleback) * Gasterosteus microcephalus Girard, 1854 (Smallhead stickleback) * Gasterosteus nipponicus Higuchi, Sakai & A. Goto, 2014 * Gasterosteus wheatlandi Putnam, 1867 (Black-spotted stickleback) === Fossil species === * †Gasterosteus kamoensis Nazarkin, Yabumoto & Urabe, 2013 == Synonyms == * Obolarius Tilesius, 1811 * Gasteracanthus Pallas, 1814 * Leiurus Swainson, 1839 * Gladiunculus Jordan & Evermann, 1927 == References == # Higuchi, M., Sakai, H. & Goto, A. (2014): A new threespine stickleback, Gasterosteus nipponicus sp. nov. (Teleostei: Gasterosteidae), from the Japan Sea region. Ichthyological Research, (61) 4: 341-351. # "Gasterosteus aculeatus". Animal Diversity Web. # Froese, Rainer; Pauly, Daniel (eds.) (2022). "Gasterosteus wheatlandi" in FishBase. August 2022 version. # Freyhof, J. & Kottelat, M. (2008). "Gasterosteus crenobiontus". IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Retrieved 15 November 2021.
